messages: 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:41): would someone mind looking at a test page, and tell me if i'm abusing <article> headings (nested in a <section>)?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:41): test page is here: http:/ 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b.com/pres/html5/index.html
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:41): i'm interested in the 'Openings and Closings' section in the bottom right of the page...
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:43): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b, looks nice. where are you unsure spec-wise?

7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:43): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: i suppose i just feel a little wary of wrapping the whole message content in an <h2>, within each 'opening and closing' <article>
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:43): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b: See http://gsnedders.html5.org/outliner/process.py?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmiketaylr.com%2Fpres%2Fhtml5%2Findex.html FWIW
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:44): If that looks sane, you're probably doing it right
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:44): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570: yeah, thanks. i've got that open as well. ;)
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:44): thanks
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:44): (Honestly, there's more than vanity at pimpin' that link)
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:44): haha
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:45): the outline is super helpful
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:46): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b: maybe it could be argued that it's more of a list than separate sections
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:46): (Like using up other people's CPU time and bandwidth, that's the real reason)
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:46): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: i see what you mean

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:47): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b: if you were a user and picked a section from the outline, you'd be disappointed to find no further content in the section :)
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:47): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: yeah, that's a good point. i think that's why i feel unsure having the whole content appear as a section.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:48): should add links to the outline

7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:49): those 'openings and closings' are actually categorized by city (london, ny, sf). so perhaps it would make more sense for the city to appear in the outline, that leads to the actual restaurant blurb
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:50): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570, your dom magic is superiour :D
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:50): superior to my judgement - it reveals that i am doing it wrong http://gsnedders.html5.org/outliner/process.py?url=http://blog.dieweltistgarnichtso.net
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:51): only the first five subheaders are articles, i forgot a section
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:51): Also the encoding is going wrong somewhere :P
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:52): Oooh, I'll be using that outliner in the future.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:52): I'll probably rewrite it from something thrown together in around ten minutes :P
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:53): I need to learn Python.  And get it running on a server.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:53): Or maybe I already have it on my server...?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:53): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570, i only see an article where someone submitted a bad URI (wordpresses fault)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:53): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570, sure you are using unicode internally ?
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:54): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: I think I ignore content-type :P
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:54): Ah, only Python 2.5.4 is available.  No Python3 goodness for me.
058f354e300cae2f9755165ed8d5131c (16:54): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570: http://gsnedders.html5.org/outliner/process.py?url=google.com
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:54): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: You don't want Python 3 yet
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:54): 058f354e300cae2f9755165ed8d5131c: Yeah, my code is awesome.
058f354e300cae2f9755165ed8d5131c (16:55): a little check on "http://" might help
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:55): the real outline is less interesting than the error:http://gsnedders.html5.org/outliner/process.py?url=http://www.google.com/
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:55): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570, can you share code?  I'd like something fun to learn from.
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:55): oops
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (16:55): http://gsnedders.html5.org/outliner/process.py?url=http://www.google.com/

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:55): 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570, i am using perfectly save XHTML5. if i ever get around to it, i'll even make sure even bad input results in XHTML5 via re-serializing. also, you can use the unicode in python via the u"" thingy.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:56): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: Just take a look at http://hg.gsnedders.com/anolis/ ‚Äî it the same outlining algorithm as there
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:56): (and the output is based upon the TOC module)
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:57): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: Yeah, I use Unicode fine, it's just detecting the charset is wrong :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:57): http://hg.gsnedders.com/anolis/file/e75817a809b8/anolislib/processes/outliner.py <-- this is not code that you want to learn python from
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:57): Probably not.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:57): Man, remove the comments and it'd be readable.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:58): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: It'd take ten times longer whenever I wanted to check that it matched the spec
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:58): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, jeah, but you can learn commenting from it :p
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:58): I suppose this is true.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (16:59): (It also blindly follows the spec and uses Hixie-goto all over the place)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (16:59): i hate this whole microdata issue. i had a plugin ready for deployment, then suddenly the spec turns around :(
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:59): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: It sucks to be an early implementor.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:59): sympathises
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:00): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, well, if everything else fails, RDFa. its not urgent, but unfortunate nevertheless.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:00): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: It can't be that bad, surely? ;) What are you doing with microdata
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:01): creative commons markup :D
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:01): has managed to put "Inner City Pressure" in his head simply by using the word "Sympathises"

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:01): I really wish I could eliminate links from the internet.  Two years later and I'm still dealing with horrifying urls showing in my 404 emails from when the Dev team decided to take a crack at web dev.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:02): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, this was an early version of it, http://daten.dieweltistgarnichtso.net/src/cc-license-markup/generator2.xhtml
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:02): heh, chromium just barfed on the outline page: http://skitch.com 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b/bh22u/chromium
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:02): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: Oh nice. I was just thinking this morning I could use microdata for marking up license bits
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:02): The only time IE creates non-tree DOMs is with misnested formatting elements, right?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (17:02): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, you are welcome to spawn more stylesheets.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:04): Do browsers use HTMLDocument for XHTML?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:06): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: which ones don't?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:06): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: apart from ancient Gecko versions
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (17:08): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I don't think Gecko does if the media type is text/xml
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:09): that's non-compliant with HTML5
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:09): I wonder if we have a bug about it

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:10): http://docs.jquery.com/UI/Datepicker#event-beforeShowDay <-- I use this event in several places in my apps, and would find it difficult to switch to <input type=date> without something like it.  Anyone think it's got a chance (presumably in v2)?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:10): hmm. looks like a bug is missing
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (17:15): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, yeah, things like that have already been raised
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:15): K, cool.  Couldn't remember seeing anything like that.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:15): Was just going through stuff yesterday and seeing how I would replace bits with HTML5.
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (17:18): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, might be 2004/2005 discussions
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:19): Ah, yeah, I definitely wasn't around then.  Had just graduated high-school the year before.  ^_^
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:19): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: Peh! Some of us only graduated high-school in June! :P
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:20): I only graduated in 2008
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:21): Craps, I am old.  I know Anne's a few months younger than me too.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:21): I'm the class of 2005 for high school.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:21): Whoa, I never realized how young everyone was.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:21): I thought I was young.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:21): Hixie: Is there a reason to believe that it's Web-compatible to make text/xml documents implement HTMLDocument and SVGDocument?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:21): I think 002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 wins for youth, though
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:21): I would agree.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:22): othermaciej: Congrats are in order!  ::pops the cork on some champagne::
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:24): I have a feeling display: run-in was specced mostly with dl's in mind
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:24): They are difficult to style without it sometimes.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:24): At least, without a <di> or ::di to hang things on.
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (17:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, Opera does it
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (17:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, also, who is using text/xml anyway?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:25): You people make me feel so old :(
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:25): I hope bz gets it into FF sometime relatively soon
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:25): You are old, oldie.
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:25): although the 1.9.2 branch has already been cut IIRC
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:25): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Yeah, well, serves you right for having a birthday cake.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:25): I don't think foregoing the cake would have allowed me to do the Dorian Grey thing
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:26): Dont' knock it til you try it.
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:26): what is the difference between code and samp and why should I use code for file names? in particular, file extensions
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:26): samp is a silly tag that we only have because there's no active reason to get rid of it.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:26): shakes his head at b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea and his b'day cake with its "special ingredient"
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:27): I just use code all the time, personally.
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:27): 2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de: In general, don't.

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:27): Crap, this whole time I've been working around javascript's stupid use of milliseconds for its timestamp.  I could have just trimmed the last three digits off at the js level and never had to deal with it leaking into my php code.  ;_;
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:27): 2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de: (Unless you really care.)
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:27): I'd say a filename is more often output from a program than "input" or "computer code"
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:27): 2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de: Use either, and ignore it :P
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:28): 2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de: It avoids the entire debate :)
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:28): heh..
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:28): the specs say I should use code for filenames though
002fd66affb058c756926402acf97570 (17:28): (The elements exist basically just for the people who really care about marking up such things semantically. Nobody in the real world does.)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:28): 2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de: Just use <code>. Seriously. No one uses <samp> for anything useful anyway
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:28): or well, it says code CAN be a filename, but that example is nto included in samp
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:28): Easy resolution, then: use <code> for filenames.  ^_^
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:29): ok
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:29): But really, just use <code> everywhere.  That's a relic from the time when people thought that someone might actually care about the distinction.
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:29): just byte the bullet
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:29): hehe
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:29): and screw over people who want everything to be semantic

2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:30): I think the distinction between kbd and code for instance can be useful, I could do something like <kbd title="aka Windows / Apple button bla bla">Super</kbd> and kbd[title] { border-bottom:..
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:31): I think half of the semantic tags won't be used anyways
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (17:31): how is that useful? ^_^
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:31): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: Nah, they'll be used, just for the wrong things.
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:31): since the distinction between several are a bit fine to easily put into WYSIWYG editors
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:31): <nav><i> is an annoying fairy.</i></nav>
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:32): and people writing HTML by hand won't bother trying to edit each and every single attribute properly
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:32): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: to add a hint?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:33): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: filed https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=512688

57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (17:33): I'd rather spend my time worrying about what my content should actually be as opposed to the fiddly semantic meanings of all of these titles, code snippets, etc.
2cc83be0233de2f6f7813e9af67fd5de (17:34): Ok, have fun with that and I'll have fun with doing it my way
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:36): Ah, cool, setting window.search does force a refresh.
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (17:36): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, hopefully someone fixes it :)
